meanings.definition: A loud, sudden, and emphatic noise or impact.
meanings.sent1: The wham of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud wham as the hammer hit the nail.
meanings.sent3: The wham of the thunder made the dog jump.
meanings.sent4: The wham of the news hitting her was like a punch to the gut.
meanings.sent5: The wham of the gavel silenced the courtroom instantly.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He whammed the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: She whammed the door shut in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chef whammed the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The boxer whammed his opponent with a strong punch.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter whammed the nail into the wood with precision.

meanings.sent1: She arrived wham at the party, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent2: The car skidded to a stop wham in front of the house.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat wham!
meanings.sent4: The storm hit the town wham, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The idea struck him wham in the middle of the night.
